p: Cytotoxicity is also regulated by administration of IVIg. In the study of Klehmet et al. [ 95], authors found that patients with chronic inflammatory demyelinating polyneuropathy treated with IVIg, showed reduction in CD8 + T cells with high levels of CD4 + T effector memory and T central memory cells. In another study, IVIg proved to reduce the activation of CD8 + T cells associated with a T-cell receptor blockade, thus reducing the interaction between effector and target cells [ 96]. In subjects with Kawasaki disease, a high proportion of CD8 + was associated with resistance to IVIg, thus suggesting that these cells could be considered a predictive factor for IVIg response [ 97].
